NEW DELHI: Dhruv Jurel , who was promoted up the order, justified the decision with an unbeaten 34-ball 52 as Rajasthan Royals defeated Lucknow Super Giants by 7 wickets to consolidate their top position and took a giant stride towards IPL 2024 playoffs.Jurel hit 2 sixes and 5 fours in his knock and put up an unbeaten 121-run stand with his skipper Sanju Samson (71*) as the Royals chased down the 197-run target with an over to spare in Lucknow on Saturday to keep their unbeaten away streak intact.After the match, the official X handle of the Indian Premier League shared a heart-warming video of Jurel celebrating his maiden IPL fifty with his family.On being asked after the match about the salute celebration after half-century, Jurel said he dedicated his milestones to his father who is in the army and his father was present to watch him play. Jurel added that he is very proud to do it in front of him.Jurel said that he intended to finish the game and he backed his shots, adding that Sanju Samson calmed him down when he was struggling to time the ball initially and that helped him a lot.After a good 60-run partnership between Yashasvi Jaiswal and Jos Buttler , the Royals suffered a mini collapse as they lost three quick wickets.But skipper Samson steadied things along with Jurel with both of them scoring brilliant fifties and getting their side over the line with an over to spare.
Article Summary: Dhruv Jurel scores unbeaten 52 as Rajasthan Royals beat Lucknow Super Giants. JureL hit 2 sixes and 5 fours in his knock and put up 121-run stand with skipper Sanju Samson. Royals chased down the 197-run target with an over to spare in Lucknow.

Article Title: 'Only plan was to...': Tushar Deshpande after taking four-fer in Chennai Super Kings' win over Sunrisers Hyderabad
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Riding on captain Ruturaj Gaikwad 's 98, Daryl Mitchell's 52, and fast-bowler Tushar Deshpande 's impressive four-wicket haul, defending champions Chennai Super Kings snapped their two-game losing streak with a commanding 78-run victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad in Match 46 of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 at the MA Chidambaram Stadium on Sunday.On a dry pitch, Gaikwad fell just two runs shy of becoming the second batter to score consecutive IPL centuries, while Mitchell achieved his maiden fifty in the tournament, guiding CSK to a substantial total of 212/3 in 20 overs.In response, SRH struggled to chase the target and were eventually bowled out for 134 in 18.5 overs, marking their second consecutive failure while batting second.Deshpande's three wickets during the powerplay contributed to his IPL-best figures of 4-22, leading CSK's outstanding bowling effort.After the win, Deshpande said CSK bowlers used the wicket well."When we came to bowl, the only plan was to have patience against SRH who are quite aggressive in the powerplay and that paid dividends for us. Bowling that length in the powerplay is crucial, even if I get hit, I always challenge the batter to hit that length again and it worked for me today," Deshpande, who claimed four wickets, said after the match."The ground was soaking wet, it swung for a couple of balls and then it did not. It was a bit sticky and I thought we used the pitch well. We had a specific plan - even if they hit a good ball, we will focus on our plans and not get carried away by them," the pacer said.Following the win, CSK moved to the third spot with 10 points, same as Kolkata Knight Riders, Lucknow Super Giants and Delhi Capitals. SRH, who are also on 10 points, slipped to fourth after their fourth loss.CSK will next face Punjab Kings on Wednesday.
Article Summary: Defending champions Chennai Super Kings beat Sunrisers Hyderabad by 78 runs. Captain Ruturaj Gaikwad scores 98, Daryl Mitchell 52, and Tushar Deshpande takes four wickets. CSK move to third spot with 10 points, same as Kolkata Knight Riders, Lucknow Super Giants and Delhi Capitals.

Article Title: 'I was upset...': Captain Ruturaj Gaikwad after Chennai Super Kings' big win over Sunrisers Hyderabad
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Tushar Deshpande's exceptional bowling in the powerplay proved to be a game-changer for the Chennai Super Kings in their 78-run victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad . Captain Ruturaj Gaikwad recognized that the pacer's performance infused the team with the momentum they had been lacking this season.Deshpande's spirited effort yielded figures of 4/27 in three overs, with three of those wickets coming during the powerplay, which dismantled the formidable SRH batting lineup spearheaded by Travis Head."One area where we lost momentum in a few games was not getting wickets in the powerplay. It is the only way we can put the opposition on the back foot. Deshpande bowled really well. His hard work is paying off," said CSK skipper Gaikwad, who scored 98 off 54 deliveries to give his team a 200-plus total to defend.With the dew giving spinners a torrid time, the onus was on Ravindra Jadeja to keep his line and length intact, and the wily spinner bowled a measly spell, giving away just 22 runs in his four overs while also taking a wicket."Special mention to Jaddu as well. In these wet conditions, four overs 20-25 runs, for me that was a match-turning spell."I'm not very vocal. Everyone is very experienced in the dressing room and you can't just go up to seniors and tell them what to do. So I just take a back seat," said Gaikwad following the win, which propelled CSK to third position on the points table.Gaikwad added that at no point in time was he thinking about a century, saying that he was "upset" with himself for missing a few big shots."I was never even thinking about the hundred. I was just trying to make sure we get to 220 or whatever extra runs possible. Even in the last game I wasn't thinking about the hundred."I was upset I missed a few shots. At the innings break I thought it would cost us. But in the end it worked out. Last game we made some errors, some loose balls here and there, not really up to the mark in the field. Today we came up with plans, stuck to them and we were excellent in the field."He said that with the 'impact sub' rule, no score is safe and the more a team scores the better it is."With the impact rule you never know the par score, you always want an extra 10-20 runs."
Article Summary: Chennai Super Kings beat Sunrisers Hyderabad by 78 runs. Tushar Deshpande took 4/27 in three overs. Ravindra Jadeja bowled 22 runs in his four overs. Captain Ruturaj Gaikwad scored 98 off 54 deliveries.

Article Title: 'Baby is on the way': Bua-to-be Sakshi Dhoni urges Chennai Super Kings to finish match fast
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Mahendra Singh Dhoni 's wife Sakshi on Sunday made a sweet and well-timed request to the Chennai Super Kings, which was met positively by the five-time champions.While cheering for the team from the stands at the Chepauk, Sakshi shared an Instagram story in which she asked the team to wrap up the game against Sunrisers Hyderabad quickly as she is expecting to become an aunt soon."Please finish the game fast today @chennaiipl. Baby is on the way... Contractions have begun. Request from - to be Bua," Sakshi's post read.Captain Ruturaj Gaikwad narrowly missed his second consecutive IPL century, while pacers Tushar Deshpande and Matheesha Pathirana dismantled the Sunrisers Hyderabad batting lineup as the Chennai Super Kings secured a 78-run victory.Gaikwad's 54-ball 98 and his 107-run partnership with Daryl Mitchell (52) helped CSK post a solid total of 212/3. Deshpande (4/27) and Pathirana (2/17) then delivered match-winning bowling performances, dismissing SRH for 134 in 18.5 overs.Deshpande took the wickets of opener Travis Head (13) and Anmolpreet Singh (0) in his first over, along with Abhishek Sharma (15) and captain Pat Cummins (5). Pathirana removed the dangerous Aiden Markram and Heinrich Klaasen, crushing SRH's batting line-up.With this decisive win, the five-time champions rose to third place in the points table.CSK now have 10 points, with 5 wins in 10 matches.Their next game will be against the Punjab Kings on Wednesday.
Article Summary: Mahendra Singh Dhoni's wife Sakshi asks Chennai Super Kings to finish the game quickly. She is expecting to become an aunt soon. CSK beat Sunrisers Hyderabad by 78 runs. Tushar Deshpande and Matheesha Pathirana took four wickets each.

Article Title: Nothing went right for us, says Pat Cummins after 78-run thrashing by CSK
Article Text: NEW DELHI: After bowlers conceded 212 in a traditionally slow Chepauk track, batters nosedived in the chase as Sunrisers Hyderabad succumbed to a heavy 78-run defeat against Chennai Super Kings on Sunday.After RCB brought back a high-flying Sunrisers down to the ground in the previous game, Pat Cummins and Co. suffered their second defeat in a row.After the defeat against CSK, the SRH skipper admitted they were outplayed and will look to come back stronger in next game."We thought chasing was our best chance to win but unfortunately it didn't come off tonight. I thought they obviously batted well but with our batting lineup, wicket was playing pretty well, so I thought we had a good chance. I think we are pretty happy with how the batting lineup is going. Nothing went right for us today but everyone in that lineup has won a game for us at some point this season, " said Cummins in the post-match presentation."It's definitely dewy now, but it was pretty dewy in the first innings as well. It's only a couple of games [lost], so we'll look to bounce back quickly," he added.Skipper Ruturaj Gaikwad's belligerent 98 was complemented by a clinical bowling display, led by pacer Tushar Deshpande, as the defending champions returned to winning ways with the fifth win of the season.Invited to bat, Gaikwad's valiant 54-ball knock was the driving force which propelled CSK to an imposing 212 for three. He was ably supported by Daryl Mitchell, who returned to form with a crucial 32-ball 52 before Shivam Dube's 20-ball 39 not out took CSK past the 200 mark.In response, SRH's ultra-cautious batting approach backfired again as they couldn't recover from Deshpande's (4/27 in 3 overs) three-wicket burst with the new ball and the middle-overs squeeze to be all out for 134 in 18.5 overs.
Article Summary: Sunrisers Hyderabad lose to Chennai Super Kings by 78 runs. CSK bowled out Sunrisers for 134 in 18.5 overs. Ruturaj Gaikwad top scored for CSK with 98. Pat Cummins says they will bounce back quickly.

Article Title: 'He can play all formats': Brett Lee hails Dhruv Jurel
Article Text: NEW DELHI: After the conclusion of the match between the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) and the Rajasthan Royals (RR) in the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024, former Australian fast bowler Bret Lee praised young wicketkeeper-batter Dhruv Jurel for his outstanding performance in the 44th match of the ongoing 17th edition of the lucrative league.The Rajasthan Royals (RR) clinched a 7-wicket victory over the Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) at the Ekana Cricket Stadium on Saturday, thanks to an unbeaten, explosive 121-run partnership between Sanju Samson and Dhruv Jurel.RR captain Samson topped the scorecard for RR with an unbeaten 71 off 33, while Jurel delivered an impressive 52 off 34 balls. LSG's bowling struggled, exacerbated by multiple dropped catches.Lee emphasized Jurel's ability to excel across all formats, noting his skill in knowing when to accelerate during his innings. Jurel's unbeaten 52-run knock included five boundaries and two sixes."He's a quality batter, he's got proper cricket shots. He can play all formats of the game and knows when to go through the gears as needed. His shots are classy and have the power to go towards the cow corner. He shows his class and continues to grow in stature," Bret Lee was quoted as saying on Jio Cinema.Further, the former right-arm pacer spoke about the opening partnership between Jos Buttler and Yashasvi Jaiswal . Both batters put on a partnership of 60 runs in just 35 balls."The first wicket partnership, you can see, 60 off 35. When you've got someone like Jos Buttler, who likes to be aggressive, and Jaiswal on the other end, they complement each other beautifully. A left-hand and right-hand combination. The great thing about the Rajasthan Royals is that they've got the combination at the top of the order and also with the ball. They complement each other beautifully," the former Australian cricketer added.'He can play all formats': Bret Lee hails Dhruv Jurel
Article Summary: Bret Lee hails Dhruv Jurel after Rajasthan Royals' 7-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants. Former Australian fast bowler praises wicketkeeper-batter's ability to play all formats. Lee also praises opening partnership between Jos Buttler and Yashasvi Jaiswal.

Article Title: 'He's a legend of the game': Will Jacks hails Virat Kohli following RCB's crushing win over GT
Article Text:
(With ANI inputs)

NEW DELHI: RCB 's batting all-rounder Will Jacks showered praise on star batter Virat Kohli , hailing him as the "legend of the game." Their formidable unbeaten partnership of 166 runs off 74 balls during the IPL 2024 clash against Gujarat Titans showcased Kohli's mastery and leadership on the field.Kohli's authoritative innings of 70 not out from 44 deliveries, marked by 6 fours and 3 sixes, underscored his prowess as a batsman.Meanwhile, Jacks' explosive unbeaten century, scoring 100 runs from just 41 balls with an impressive strike rate of 243.90, highlighted his exceptional batting skills.Reflecting on their partnership, Jacks expressed admiration for Kohli, acknowledging him as a role model for cricketers worldwide. Jacks emphasised the invaluable learning experience gained from playing alongside the talismanic batter, indicating the profound impact of Kohli's mentorship on his cricketing journey.The right-handed batter added that he needs to be more "adaptable" at the start of his innings in the upcoming matches."It's amazing, he's a legend of the game and is someone everyone looks up to. To spend some time in the middle is a great feeling, a huge learning curve. When I go away from the IPL, I'll learn so much from batting with him and playing with him. I'll try to take it all on board. I need to be a bit more adaptable at the beginning of my innings and get myself in a little bit quicker," Jacks said.In the match, RCB won the toss and opted to field first. GT's Sai Sudharsan (84) andShahrukh Khan (58) put up a commendable performance, guiding their team to a total of 200/3. Despite a strong start by GT, RCB's bowlers struggled initially, with only Maxwell, Siraj, and Swapnil managing to take wickets.In response, RCB's run chase was led by Kohli (70*) and Jacks (100*), who steered their team to victory with a stellar partnership. RCB secured their third win of the season, defeating GT by 9 wickets. Sai Kishore was the lone wicket-taker for GT, dismissing Faf du Plessis in the fourth over.
Article Summary: Will Jacks hails Virat Kohli as the "legend of the game" RCB beat Gujarat Titans by 9 wickets in IPL 2024 clash. Kohli (70) and Jacks (100) scored 166 runs off 74 balls. RCB won the toss and opted to field first.

Article Title: 'Need Sher ka Jigar not Strike Rate': Mohammad Kaif hails Virat Kohli after RCB's third win
Article Text:
(With inputs from ANI)

NEW DELHI: Virat Kohli 's solid 44-ball 70 not out against Gujarat Titans in Ahmedabad on Sunday earned him high praise from former India batter Mohammad Kaif . Kohli's composed knock, alongside Will Jacks blitz, left the opposition stunned as the duo powered Royal Challengers Bengaluru to a commanding 9-wicket victory.Throughout this IPL , Kohli has consistently showcased his batting prowess and on Sunday reached the milestone of 500 runs for the seventh consecutive time in a season.Kaif's commendation of Kohli's performance came amidst recent criticism surrounding the star batter's strike-rate.Kohli's unbeaten 70 in the clash against Titans also effectively silenced his critics, demonstrating his ability to adapt and excel in various match situations.Kaif praised the experienced star and pinpointed the importance of Kohli by recalling the six that he struck in Haris Rauf's over during India's clash against Pakistan in the previous edition of the T20 World Cup.The fiery 166-run partnership between Virat Kohli and Will Jacks also etched the record books. It was the highest partnership scored against Titans in the history of the IPL. Rajasthan Royals' Sanju Samson and Riyan Parag's 130-run partnership holds second place on the highest partnership scored against the Gujarat-based side.Kohli also equalled David Warner's record of most 500-plus runs in IPL seasons. Both Kohli and Warner have crossed the 500-run mark seven times in an IPL season.Coming to the match, after putting GT to bat, Sai Sudharsan (86*) and Shahrukh Khan's (58) blitz powered the hosts to a competitive total of 200/3.In reply, after skipper Faf du Plessis's dismissal, Kohli and Jacks rattled GT's bowling unit with their 166*-run stand to clinch a 9-wicket win for RCB
Article Summary: Mohammad Kaif praises Virat Kohli for his unbeaten 70 not out against Gujarat Titans. Kohli and Will Jacks' 166-run stand was the highest partnership scored against Titans in the history of the IPL. The duo powered Royal Challengers Bengaluru to a 9-wicket victory.

Article Title: Ruturaj Gaikwad's bold 98 propels Chennai Super Kings to 212/3 against Sunrisers Hyderabad in IPL
Article Text:
(With PTI inputs)

NEW DELHI: Ruturaj Gaikwad fell just short of a consecutive century, but his brilliant innings powered Chennai Super Kings to a formidable total of 212 for three against Sunrisers Hyderabad in the Indian Premier League clash in Chennai.Gaikwad's commanding 98 off 54 deliveries set the tone for CSK's innings, supported by Daryl Mitchell 's crucial 52 off 32 balls and Shivam Dube 's explosive 39 not out off 20 deliveries.Gaikwad's aggressive stroke play, comprising 10 fours and three sixes, anchored CSK's innings after an early dismissal of opener Ajinkya Rahane .Gaikwad's fluent batting saw him reach his 17th IPL half-century in just 27 deliveries, laying a solid foundation for CSK.The partnership between Gaikwad and Mitchell proved pivotal, with both batsmen finding the boundaries consistently.Mitchell, after a slow start, accelerated to register his maiden IPL fifty off 29 balls before falling to Jaydev Unadkat .Shivam Dube's explosive cameo, combined with Gaikwad's determined effort, propelled CSK past the 200-run mark.Despite Gaikwad's dismissal in the final over, MS Dhoni and Dube ensured CSK finished strongly, adding 53 runs in the last four overs.Overall, Gaikwad's stellar knock and contributions from Mitchell and Dube laid the groundwork for CSK's commanding total.
Article Summary: Ruturaj Gaikwad scores 98 off 54 deliveries to power Chennai Super Kings to 212-3. Daryl Mitchell and Shivam Dube add 52 and 39 not out for CSK. MS Dhoni and Dube added 53 runs in the last four overs to finish strongly.

Article Title: 'Not able to pick up wickets in...': Shubman Gill decrypts Gujarat Titans' nine-wicket loss against RCB
Article Text:
(With ANI inputs)

NEW DELHI: After Gujarat Titans ' nine-wicket defeat against Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the Indian Premier League, skipper Shubman Gill analyzed the match and highlighted their failure to take wickets in the middle overs as a key factor in their loss.The GT bowlers had a lackluster performance, managing to take only one wicket during the second inning on Sunday.Gill himself had a modest innings, scoring 16 runs from 19 balls at a strike rate of 84.21. He struck just one boundary during his time at the crease.Speaking after the match, Gill praised the outstanding performances of Virat Kohli and Will Jacks against GT on Sunday. He emphasized the importance of devising improved strategies and plans for their upcoming matches in the tournament based on their learnings from this game."I think it was great hitting by them (Kohli and Jacks.) We need to come up with better plans in the next match, also need to execute them. When you are batting you can always think of scoring 15-20 runs more. We thought 200 was a good enough total for us, unfortunately, it didn't turn out the way we wanted it to. We were not able to pick up wickets in the middle overs, I think that was the turning point for us," Gill said.Recapping the match, RCB won the toss and decided to field against GT. Following this, Sai Sudharsan (84) and Shahrukh Khan (58) displayed a stellar performance to propel GT to 200/3.The RCB bowlers were sloppy in the opening of the game. Maxwell, Siraj, and Swapnil were the only wicket-takers for the visitors.During the run chase, Virat Kohli (70) and Will Jacks (100) handed RCB their third win of the season by beating GT by 9 wickets.Sai Kishore was the only wicket-taker for the GT after he dismissed Faf du Plessis in the fourth over.Following the win, RCB still stand in the bottom place on the IPL 2024 standings with six points. Meanwhile, GT hold the seventh place with 8 points after winning four of 10 matches.
Article Summary: Gujarat Titans lost to Royal Challengers Bengaluru by nine wickets on Sunday. Shubman Gill praised the outstanding performances of Virat Kohli and Will Jacks. GT bowlers had a lackluster performance, managing to take only one wicket.

Article Title: 'There is no help for bowlers': Mohammed Siraj blames smaller grounds and flat wickets
Article Text:
"Winning all games is the only possibility to qualify"

(With PTI inputs)

NEW DELHI: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) pacer Mohammed Siraj expressed frustration over the challenging conditions for bowlers in T20 cricket , lamenting the lack of assistance from smaller grounds and flat pitches.Siraj highlighted the trend of teams consistently surpassing the 250-run mark in this IPL season, a testament to the ultra-aggressive batting approach and the influence of the 'Impact player' rule.With batsmen capitalising on favourable conditions, bowlers face an uphill battle in containing high-scoring totals. Siraj's remarks shed light on the evolving dynamics of T20 cricket, where batsmen hold the upper hand in exploiting conducive playing surfaces to set daunting targets."See, nowadays cricket is really different, now 250-260 is made in every second match, earlier 250 was a rare thing," said Siraj after RCB overhauled the 201-run target set by Gujarat Titans in 16 overs in Ahmedabad."There is no help for bowlers, there are smaller grounds and flat wickets, there is no swing in the ball, so lots of changes. Bowlers can just keep playing and keep getting hit."Life has indeed been challenging for bowlers, particularly in this IPL season, as teams prioritise aggressive batting to maintain high run-rates throughout the innings, even beyond the powerplay overs."As a bowler, you have to keep the self-belief. I have seen lots of ups and downs in life, so I don't give up if 1-2 matches don't go my way. I look for a comeback," Siraj said."After one month, there is the World Cup... so I tell myself that if I get hit on a good ball, it is fine but I need to keep bowling less bad balls. I have not really bowled too badly this IPL, now 40 runs (in quota of four overs) is normal in T20 cricket."Siraj, with six wickets in nine IPL games this season, acknowledged the significant role of luck in T20 cricket."T20 is all about luck, you don't get a wicket with good balls and sometimes even a full toss gets you a wicket. so luck matters a lot. I keep working on my flaws during training."My mindset is always like I am the best bowler, when I go to the field, my attitude and mindset remains the same and it helps in my execution."Despite Gujarat Titans enduring their third loss in four games, Sai Sudharsan maintained that there are no glaring issues within the team. However, he emphasised the critical importance of winning all remaining matches to bolster their chances of qualifying for the playoffs."I don't think many things are going wrong. As a team we are doing well, definitely. It's just the result. If we had won this game, maybe many things would have been good. Getting better and just showing up (for) the next game is what is very important," said Sudharsan, who hit a 49-ball 84.GT are now at seventh place with eight points in the IPL standings."I think winning all the games is the only possibility which we can see. But I think taking it game by game, just getting better from this game. There were many positives from this game as well. Thinking of qualifying is a little longer. So, we just have to play the way we want."The left-handed batter said the pitch eased out with time which helped RCB chase down the target without much ado."Like 10-15 overs after when we were batting, it got a little better because when we started to play, the wicket was q little damp but eventually it got better under the lights. It remained the same, obviously, during the RCB's innings as well."
Article Summary: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) pacer Mohammed Siraj expressed frustration over the challenging conditions for bowlers in T20 cricket. Siraj highlighted the trend of teams consistently surpassing the 250-run mark in this IPL season. RCB overhauled the 201-run target set by Gujarat Titans in 16 overs.

Article Title: What happened in first leg doesn't matter, it starts 0-0: Kratky
Article Text: MUMBAI: The final minutes of Mumbai City 's first leg semifinal against FC Goa at Fatorda last week was effectively a microcosm of the Islanders' season.Trailing 2-0 until the final minute of regulation time, Petr Kratky's side demonstrated the resilience that has seen them make light of several setbacks over the course of the campaign. Like losing their head coach Des Buckingham who left the club to take over at hometown club Oxford United last November.Like losing key players like Greg Stewart and Rostyn Griffiths , who both parted ways with Mumbai City in January.Like signing Spanish striker Iker Guarrotxena in the January window, only to then lose him for the remainder of the season to a knee injury. Each time, Mumbai bounced back to ensure their league form didn't suffer and eventually only missed out on becoming the first team in the competition to defend the League Winners Shield after a gutting final-day loss to Mohun Bagan Super Giant in Kolkata.It was that same resilience that surfaced at a critical juncture last Wednesday, as Mumbai stunned the hosts with three late goals to snatch an incredible victory that has now put them in a favourable position to reach the Indian Super League final next Saturday.Ahead of Monday's return leg at the Mumbai Football Arena, Kratky, who took charge in December, spoke glowingly about the character of his team, but made it a point to play down their one-goal advantage."It wasn't easy, there were a couple of setbacks as everyone knows but we can be proud of ourselves how we have handled it and how we kept going," the Czech-Australian said at his pre-match press conference. "What I really like in this group is they stick together in hard times and push through it, so I'm very proud of every single one of them."That said, he was keen to remind his side about the importance of stepping onto the pitch on Monday with the right approach. "If you put it into perspective, we were losing 2-0 in 90 minutes, so everything certainly was not perfect. But we have addressed that," Kratky said."We know it will be a difficult game. Goa is a quality team. We have to respect that. But what happened last game, it doesn't matter. For me, it starts 0-0 and we have to go for the win."Goa coach Manolo Marquez admitted the manner in which his side saw their 2-0 lead turn into a 3-2 defeat inside six minutes had been tough to swallow, but the Spanish coach insisted the Gaurs would carry no psychological scars into the second leg."It's a process because it was a tough defeat and then it's normal to be very sad after the game. It was difficult to sleep that night, it was difficult the next day in the training session, Marquez said, adding: "I am completely sure that even if we did lose the last match, we will arrive in very good conditions mentally for the second leg."Mumbai won't be able to count on left back Akash Mishra who is injured, while Kratky said he was hopeful of having Spanish attacking midfielder Alberto Noguera available for selection. Goa, meanwhile, will badly miss the services of winger Mohammad Yasir who suffered an injury in the first leg.
Article Summary: Mumbai City beat FC Goa 3-2 in the first leg of their Indian Super League semifinal. Petr Kratky's side lead 2-0 until the final minute of regulation time at Fatorda. Goa coach Manolo Marquez insists his side will carry no psychological scars into second leg.
